clinical_study.brief_title: IgM-enriched Immunoglobulin Attenuates Systemic Endotoxin Activity in Early Severe Sepsis
clinical_study.official_title: Immunoglobulin-M-enriched (IgM-enriched) Immunoglobulin Attenuates Systemic Endotoxin Activity in Early Severe Sepsis

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the effect of IgM-enriched immunoglobulins (Pentaglobin) on the endotoxin activity, conventional coagulation parameters, viscoelastic and aggregometric measurements of patients with severe sepsis.

detailed_description.textblock: Before the change of the standard operating procedure (SOP) with the implementation of the application of IgM-enriched immunoglobulins to patients with severe sepsis and septic shock conventional inflammatory and coagulation parameters, viscoelastic and aggregometric measurements as well as the endotoxin activity was measured in 15 patients. After the change of SOP the same parameters were recorded for additional 15 patients.

primary_outcome.description: The endotoxin activity of the patients was measured with a point of care assay and noted in on an arbitrary scale from 0 to 1.0

secondary_outcome.description: Changes in clotting time (CT) of the naturally activated rotational thrombelastometry (ROTEM), results were noted in seconds.
Changes in maximum clot firmness (MCF) of the naturally activated rotational thrombelastometry (ROTEM), results were noted in millimeters.
Changes in clot formation time (CFT) of the naturally activated rotational thrombelastometry (ROTEM), results were noted in seconds.
Changes in Alpha angle of the naturally activated rotational thrombelastometry (ROTEM), results were noted in °.
Platelet activation was measured as the area under the curve of a multiple electrode aggregometry. Platelets were activated using adenosine diphosphate (ADPtest)
Platelet activation was measured as the area under the curve of a multiple electrode aggregometry. Platelets were activated using arachidonic acid (ASPItest)
Platelet activation was measured as the area under the curve of a multiple electrode aggregometry. Platelets were activated using thrombin receptor activating peptide (TRAPtest)
Platelet count was determined in the clinical routine and noted /nl.
Interleukin-6 level was determined in the clinical routine and was noted in pg/ml.
Leukocyte count was determined in the clinical routine and was noted /µl.
Lipopolysaccharide-binding-protein (LBP) was determined in the clinical routine and was noted in µg/l.

study_pop.textblock: Patients with severe sepsis or septic shock in a surgical, tertiary care ICU

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age >18 years
- proven or suspected severe sepsis or septic shock
- written consent of the patient or a legal person in charge
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy
- anticoagulation other than heparin
- Inherited coagulopathy or thrombophilia
